result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy L Delair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs have been paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy L Delair

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amy L Delair appeared by phone. Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State reviews payment via credit card.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

ADDRESS INFO for Amy L Delair
Current: P.O. Box 533, Littleton, NH 03561 United States  (Effective: 11-03-2015)
Prior: 505 Main St Apt 2, Franconia, NH 03580

Defendant Amy L Delair in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State advises that sentencing will be put off for about a month to allow Defendant time to pay costs and will then have joint recommendation for costs only at sentencing due to today's payment in full of restitution.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Amy L Delair and attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that things have not gone well for Defendant, is having issues with landlord and employment, doesn't have ability to pay to come back, requests status in 45 days. State questions why case is being put off so long. Defense advises that Defendant doesn't have money to get back here.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Bond given to Defense to send to Defendant.
Not to write any checks. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Amy L Delair appeared by phone. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Bond set.  Defense enters not guilty pleas, has obtained restitution amount. Defendant can appear by phone at status conference.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Certificate of Service. Atty Gerbers just realized this morning that she's from NH, has not been in contact with Defendant to find out her plan about case. Court will allow Defendant to appear by phone.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
